snippet: The World Health Organization issued a new alert on the disease, which was once thought to be nearly eradicated, saying three countries had allowed it to spread.
abstract: World Health Organization declares global health emergency due to alarm over the spread of polio to several fragile countries; it is the second time organization has declared an emergency since regulations permitting it to do so were adopted in 2007.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Anne Barnard, Dan Bilefsky, Rick Gladstone and Salman Masood.

lead_paragraph: The World Health Organization issued a new alert on the disease, which was once thought to be nearly eradicated, saying three countries had allowed it to spread.

headline.main: Polio’s Return After Near Eradication Prompts a Global Health Warning
headline.print_headline: Polio’s Return After Near Eradication Prompts a Global Health Warning
